newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 22.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Tuesday:

** The government has allowed foreign construction firms to operate in Indonesia following a recent decision to take the construction sector out of the country's negative investment list, the chairman of the Indonesian Construction Companies Association, Agus Kartasasmita, said.
** Sampoerna Investment Corporation, a subsidiary of cigarette giant H.M. Sampoerna, said it planned to sell a 2.85 percent stake in automobile conglomerate Astra .
** The Dow Jones industrial average fell 3.36 points to 6,090.87 on Monday as investors took a breather after the market raced to four new highs last week.

** The Jakarta Composite Index rose 1.08 points, or 0.19 percent, to close at 570.20 points following bargain-hunting in some blue-chip stocks coupled with local-led speculative buying of some secondaries.
** On Tuesday, the Indonesian rupiah was at 2,324.40/24.75 in early trading against an opening of 2,324.25/24.50.
** H.M. Sampoerna and Astra International on a newspaper report that Sampoerna's subsidiary Sampoerna Investment Corporation planned to sell its 2.85 percent stake in Astra.
** Matahari Putra Prima on reports the giant retailer expected to slow down its expansion drive in a bid to boost earnings.
** Rimba Niaga Idola on market talk that the trading firm was likely to announce a rights issue later this month.
